triples.name: Temporal logic
triples.relevance: Signal Temporal Logic (STL) is a specialized form of temporal logic used to specify formal requirements for the multi-agent motion planning task.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel motion planning method based on timed waypoints that handles complex STL specifications and multi-agent coordination.

triples.name: Model predictive control
triples.relevance: MPC is an existing motion planning approach that the proposed method addresses limitations of in terms of scalability and complexity handling.

triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: The paper formulates waypoint search as a mixed-integer linear program to find timed waypoints satisfying STL specifications.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a method for cooperative motion planning in multi-agent systems with automatic task allocation and specification satisfaction.

triples.name: Nonholonomic system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses motion planning for robots with nonholonomic dynamics, where velocity constraints cannot be derived from position constraints.

triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: The proposed method guarantees that agents following timed waypoints avoid collisions with other agents while satisfying STL specifications.
